intro: Cordyline bartelii, commonly known as the Natal pine or Natal palm, is a tropical plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, feathery leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and high salt exposure. It produces small, white flowers that are followed by red, fleshy fruits. Cordyline bartelii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
